page.title: 14Arable Farming Hardwick area
page.content: There is a variety in size and output in the majority of farms in this area. Two of the main farms have areas of 285 and 600 acres including buildings, woods and homestead. The smaller one has one permanent employee beside the farmer. Casual labour is taken on as needed i.e. for harvesting, lambing and dipping. The larger farm has four permanent employees. Cereals and sugar beet are the major crops on the clay areas with some rape (for rapeseed production), potatoes and peas. Soft fruit often occupies a small area of the farm, strawberries and raspberries growing well on the sandy soil. Some farmers grow vegetables for people to buy direct, after the Pick-your-Own fruit season. Courgettes, peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers, root, tuber and brassica vegetables are popular.
